page.title: 04ECOLOGY
page.content:
Badgers were poisoned for they were thought to carry a disease and pass it on to cattle.Quite a few badgers are knocked down by cars and the population is unfortunately small and is not increasing.
Foxes are at large in the countryside and are shot a lot because they are a threat to lambs,ducks,geese,chickens and sometimes on pheasant farms pheasants are killed by the fox.Hunts to kill the fox are set up but some animal lovers spray lemon mixed with garlic on fox runs to throw the hounds off the scent.Foxes are poisoned or snared to keep the population down.Foxes live in earths and dens and have a thick,bushy tail known as the brush.
